options.text: Because they are designed to only read number 2 pencils

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are designed to only read HB pencils

title: Why are we ticklish?

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for the itchy feeling caused by a light touch on sensitive skin?

options.label: A
options.text: Gargalesis

options.label: B
options.text: Knismesis

options.label: C
options.text: Tickling

options.label: D
options.text: Laughter

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following is a theory about the evolutionary purpose of gargalesis?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a mechanism for teaching young apes and humans how to protect themselves if attacked.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a way for primates to communicate with each other.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a reflex to help remove parasites from the skin.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a way to relieve stress and anxiety.

multiple-choice.question: Where are primates typically ticklish?

options.label: A
options.text: On the soles of their feet

options.label: B
options.text: On the palms of their hands

options.label: C
options.text: In areas such as the ribs, under the arms, under the chin, and near the femoral artery

options.label: D
options.text: On the top of their head

multiple-choice.question: What is the typical response to gargalesis?

options.label: A
options.text: A negative facial expression

options.label: B
options.text: A neutral facial expression

options.label: C
options.text: A mixture of pain and pleasure, accompanied by laughter and smiling

options.label: D
options.text: No response at all

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Cat

options.label: C
options.text: Chimpanzee

options.label: D
options.text: Fish

title: How old are your ears? (hearing test)

multiple-choice.question: What happens to our hearing spectrum as we grow older?

options.label: A
options.text: We gain the ability to hear higher frequencies.

options.label: B
options.text: We lose the ability to hear lower frequencies.

options.label: C
options.text: We lose the extreme ends of our hearing spectrum.

options.label: D
options.text: Our hearing spectrum remains the same.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the tiny nerve cells in the ear responsible for picking up different frequencies?

options.label: A
options.text: Cochlear cells

options.label: B
options.text: Hair cells

options.label: C
options.text: Auditory cells

options.label: D
options.text: Nerve endings

multiple-choice.question: Why do the hair cells tuned to high pitches tend to degenerate earlier?

options.label: A
options.text: They are less sensitive to sound waves.

options.label: B
options.text: They experience more stress from sound waves.

options.label: C
options.text: They are less important for hearing.

options.label: D
options.text: They are more resistant to noise.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the continual exposure to noise and loud sounds on the hair cells in the ear?

options.label: A
options.text: They become stronger and more resilient.

options.label: B
options.text: They remain unaffected.

options.label: C
options.text: They break, bend, and destroy.

options.label: D
options.text: They regenerate and multiply.

multiple-choice.question: Unlike other organs, what is a characteristic of the inner ear?

options.label: A
options.text: It has the capacity to regenerate.

options.label: B
options.text: It is immune to damage from noise.

options.label: C
options.text: It has a limited capacity to regenerate.

options.label: D
options.text: It does not have the capacity to regenerate.

title: What makes you special?
